title: Using OpenID Connect (OIDC) Multitenancy in Quarkus
summary: The guide illustrates how to support multitenancy in a Quarkus application using OpenID Connect. It covers setting up a single application to serve multiple tenants, utilizing different OIDC providers like Keycloak and Google. Key topics include architectural details, prerequisites, solution steps, tenant-specific configurations, and endpoint definitions. Additionally, it includes dynamic tenant configuration resolution and integration with other security layers like Hibernate ORM or MongoDB with Panache for synchronized tenant resolution.
